noun.description: In Mexico and the Philippines: the chief official of a town or village. Now historical.
The president of a Spanish-speaking country or sovereign state.
A Cuban cocktail made from white rum, vermouth, grenadine, and curaçao.

origin: Mid 19th century; earliest use found in Littell's Living Age. From Spanish presidente governor (of the Philippines), president, head of state, type of Cuban cocktail (not dated in dictionaries of Spanish): see president.
